BJT Construction and Operation
>
BJT Symbols and Structure
>
NPN Transistor
>
E >C >B >
PNP Transistor
>
E >C >B >
NPN Physical Structure
>
N+ >Emitter
>
P >Base
>
N >Collector
>
• Thin base region >• Heavy emitter doping >• Large collector area >
>
Biasing Modes
>
Active Mode
>
+ >VBE >
+ >VCE >
VBE > 0.7V >VCE > VBE >
>
Saturation Mode
>
VBE > 0.7V VCE < 0.2V>
>
Cutoff Mode
VBE < 0.7V> IC ≈ 0 >
>
Current Flow Mechanism
>
>
>
IE >
IC >
IB >
Emitter >Base >Collector
> IE = IB + IC >IC = β × IB >β = 50-300 >
>
BJT Characteristic Curves
>
Input Characteristics (IB vs VBE)
>
0.7V
> Exponential >Region
> VBE (V) >IB (μA)
> IB = IS(e^(qVBE/kT) - 1) >
Output Characteristics (IC vs VCE)
>
IB = 40μA
> IB = 30μA
> IB = 20μA
> IB = 10μA
> Active Region >Saturation
>
VCE(sat)
> VCE (V) >IC (mA) >
>
BJT Parameters and Relationships
>
Current Gain Parameters
>DC Current Gain (β or hFE): >β = IC/IB >Typical range: 50-300 >Temperature dependent
>AC Current Gain (β or hfe): >β = ΔIC/ΔIB >Similar to DC β >Frequency dependent
> Common Base Gain (α): >α = IC/IE = β/(β+1) >Typical value: 0.95-0.99 >α = IC/IE, β = IC/IB
> Key Relationships: >IE = IB + IC >IC = β × IB >IE = (β+1) × IB >β = α/(1-α) >
>
Small Signal Model
>
Hybrid-π Model
> B >
rπ
>
Cπ >
gmvπ >
ro >
Cμ >
C >
E >
rπ = βVT/IC >gm = IC/VT >ro = VA/IC >VT = 26mV @ 300K >VA = Early voltage >
T-Model (Alternative)
>
re >
αie >
re = VT/IE ≈ 26mV/IE >α ≈ 1 for high β >
>
Fabrication and BJT Types
>
Fabrication Methods
>Planar Process: >• Photolithography and etching >• Oxide masking for selective doping >• Multiple diffusion steps >• Precise geometry control
>Key Design Features: • Thin base width (< 1μm) • Heavy emitter doping >• Large collector area >• Low base resistance >
BJT Types and Applications
>• Small Signal BJT: Audio amplifiers, switching >• Power BJT: Motor drives, power supplies >• RF BJT: High frequency amplifiers >• Darlington Pair: High current gain >• Digital BJT: Logic circuits, switches >• HBT: GaAs/Si heterostructures >• SiGe BJT: High speed applications >• IGBT: Power switching hybrid >
